dt: {bc}to assist (one acting or reciting) by suggesting or saying the next words of something forgotten or imperfectly learned {bc}{sx|cue||}
{bc}to serve as the inciting cause of

et: Middle English, from Medieval Latin {it}promptare{/it}, from Latin {it}promptus{/it} prompt
shortdef: to assist (one acting or reciting) by suggesting or saying the next words of something forgotten or imperfectly learned : cue
to serve as the inciting cause of
of or relating to prompting actors

dt: {bc}being ready and quick to act as occasion demands

pt: {sc}quick{/sc} {sc}prompt{/sc} {sc}ready{/sc} {sc}apt{/sc} mean able to respond without delay or hesitation or indicative of such ability. {sc}quick{/sc} stresses instancy of response and is likely to connote native rather than acquired power.
{sc}prompt{/sc} is more likely to connote training and discipline that fits one for instant response.
{sc}ready{/sc} suggests facility or fluency in response.

pt.t: backed by a pair of {it}ready{/it} assistants

pt: {sc}apt{/sc} stresses the possession of qualities (such as intelligence, a particular talent, or a strong bent) that makes quick effective response possible.

pt.t: her answer was {it}apt{/it} and to the point

et: Middle English, from Latin {it}promptus{/it} ready, prompt, from past participle of {it}promere{/it} to bring forth, from {it}pro-{/it} forth + {it}emere{/it} to take {ma}{mat|redeem|}{/ma}
shortdef: being ready and quick to act as occasion demands

dt: {bc}a limit of time given for payment of an account for goods purchased
{bc}the contract by which this time is fixed

shortdef: a limit of time given for payment of an account for goods purchased; also : the contract by which this time is fixed

dt: {bc}the side of the stage adjacent to the prompter's corner
{bc}the side of the stage to the right of an actor facing the audience

shortdef: the side of the stage adjacent to the prompter's corner
the side of the stage to the right of an actor facing the audience
